intro: Laphamia ciliata, commonly known as the silky lichen, is a species of lichen that exhibits unique botanical characteristics. It belongs to the family Parmeliaceae and is known for its intricate thallus structure, which is typically foliose in form. The plant features a bright green to yellowish-green coloration due to the presence of chlorophyll and other pigments. It thrives in humid and shaded environments, often found on tree trunks and rocks. Laphamia ciliata plays an important ecological role in nutrient cycling and serves as a habitat for various microorganisms.
